Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Someone just gave a great suggestion.... Let notaries be dynamic, set their pay % on the chain, every 2 months notaris can leave or enter as they see fit based on costs just liek miners... If a notary cannot do their job they just drop out... If notaries are killing it, more just join. Dont really need a vote or anything, because we are jsut paid to notarise. The value of the coin will determine how many notaries there are.. 

Make the bounty system seperate with a multisig for that. Notaries job is to notarise. By letting basically anyone be one upto a limit of 64 you solve the collusion problem also. There is only 1 possible thing that can stop this working and I already know how to fix it, and will not be disclosing what it is until it is fixed 😄

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
I'm not sure how to design the functionality (given that no one has any CoinX to base "votes" off to begin with), but I think that it needs to be a "free election system" to avoid:
\* us picking our friends - centralization
\* me making 14 accounts, not being me on 13 of them, and picking up a dozen nodes
because we need:
\* at least a minimalistic vetting process
\* us not picking our friends

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
I fell like something like this will work, but maybe we still missing something:
1) every 2 months there is 2 spots avalible, until we reach 64 nodes. Provided nobody drops out or decides to leave. 
2) If soemone is litterally gone/their node is attacking us/ etc .. being bad actor., other ntoaries vote to remove that node (by majority vote)
3) the genral election is run where the 2 spots are given out. Maybe a short list is voted by that is then chosen at random. 

This prevents the thing growing too fast beyond what it can sustain. As is a notary cannot fill their obligation they are replaced by a new voted in node. If it is growing, and it nobody wants to leave we still have the 2 spots. After this stage, when we get to 64 (if we get there) we use a yearly election same as KMD. 

❓
